summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 9, 2019. It details routine institutional operations, staff shortages, equipment issues, and inmate statuses, including placements in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and on suicide watch. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations on a date close to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Daily Operations at MCC New York
events.description: Routine correctional facility activities including inmate placements in Special Housing Unit (SHU) and on suicide watch, staff shortages leading to vacated assignments, and a reported inoperative fire panel.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report documents the operational status of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 9, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.
It notes an inmate (I/M) was placed on suicide watch with an inmate companion, and another inmate was placed in a dry cell in R&D holding.
Significant staff shortages are reported, leading to the vacating of multiple correctional assignments including sanitation, phone monitor, and recreation officers.
The facility's Control Center Fire Panel is reported as inoperative.
The report provides institutional inmate totals, showing 759 inmates at the beginning of the morning watch shift on August 9, 2019.
